title: Assembly Helper / Nights
job_description:
At WeldFit, the position of Assembly Helper / Nights is responsible for helping machinists, welders and other operators as per customers order by performing the duties and responsibilities below.

Duties/Expectations:

  • Assembles mechanical parts, pieces or products using a variety of tools and equipment according to required specifications in our downstream production line
  • Assembles components by examining connections for correct fit; fastening parts and subassemblies
  • Read, interpret and follow basic blueprints, diagrams, engineering drawings, specifications, bills of materials, and other written instructions or procedures to accurately assemble equipment and products
  • Have a general understanding of Valves, Flanged, and Bolting
  • Responsible for helping machinists, welders and other operators as per customers order
  • Responsible for overall cleanliness and maintenance of the building by performing the following duties 
    • Obtains various materials for jobs from stock area.
    • Clean tools at end of each shift
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.
  • Work and think safety at all times
  • Must be able to work overtime and weekends with minimum notice
  • Must be able to work responsibly and independently with little supervision

Education/Experience Required:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Prior experience in similar job

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to stand, walk, bend and climb
  • Capability of lifting up to 50 lbs. on a regular basis
  • High Level of manual dexterity
  • Good mechanical aptitude

Required Skills:

  • Verbal Communication in English
  • English Reading Skills
  • English Writing Skills
  • Spanish Language Skills is a plus
  • Time Management Skills
  • Organizational Skills
  • Mathematic Aptitude

title: Door Manufacturer/ Assembler
job_description:
Overview: 

Do you enjoy working with your hands, and breaking the boundaries of the traditional office job? Are you interested in a career with a family-owned company that is founded on growth, stability, and the idea that “nothing is impossible”? 84 Lumber is hiring immediately and has the career for you!

WHO IS 84?

84 Lumber is the nation’s largest privately held supplier of building materials, manufactured components and industry-leading services for single and multi-family residences and commercial buildings. With over 310 facilities and plans for even more locations, the opportunities to learn and grow with the company are endless. 

84 Lumber is always looking for future leaders and takes pride in promoting nearly 100% from within. You can control your own destiny at 84 Lumber. If you invest in yourself, we will invest in you! 

FULL SUITE OF BENEFITS!

  • PTO, sick and personal days
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • Holiday pay
  • FSA medical and dependent care
  • Annual profit sharing and 401(k) with employer match (decided each year based on company profits)
  • Employee discounts and more!

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

The Door Shop Manufacturer is responsible for, but not limited to: Working on a Door Pre-hanging assembly line and keeping up on routine maintenance of equipment. 

LOCATION: 12020 Barker Cypress Rd. Cypress, TX 77433 

PAY: $13/HR + depending on experience

SCREENINGS:

  • Must authorize a background check (84 Lumber believes in second chances and rehabilitation. Disclosing a criminal history will NOT automatically disqualify you from employment. Each situation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Failure to disclose all requested information may result in your ineligibility for employment or continued employment).
  • Must pass urinalysis drug screening.

Responsibilities: 

Acting as a machine operator, utilizing power saws, air nail guns, staplers and other tools needed to prep wood material used to assemble doors. 

Forklift training, certification, and operation. 

Loading, unloading, storing and packaging production material from the warehouse as needed. 

Monitoring quality assurance throughout the production process. 

Maintaining a clean and safe work environment and observing all safety rules posted in the warehouse. 

Qualifications: 

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos; write simple correspondence; effectively present information to others one-on-one 

Ability to apply common sense understanding and carry out simple one or two-step instructions; deal with standardized situations with only occasional or no variables. 

Must be able to periodically lift up to 80 pounds 

High school diploma or general education degree (GED) 

84 Lumber Company is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. 84 Lumber Company is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, contact recruiting@84lumber.com.

title: Assembly Apprentice Technician
job_description:

About the Company: RelaDyne, Inc. is the established leader in lubricant sales, distribution, equipment reliability services, and value-added services. Our location is currently looking for a Assembly Apprentice Technician with a strong work ethic. Please apply or share with your friends today!

Job Objective: RelaDyne Reliability Services is looking for an Assembly Apprentice Technician to support manufacturing production. This dependable and motivated assembly apprentice technician is responsible for assembling LSC product using a variety of tools and equipment according to standard drawings and procedures within the manufacturing organization.

Job Duties:

  • Assemble equipment in accordance with quality standards and established safety procedures.
  • Operates crane/forklift/pallet jack to maneuver parts or equipment within a workstation.
  • Reads and interprets blueprints; checks shop orders/bill of materials to ensure that all necessary parts are accounted for; and informs supervisor of any shortages in parts or hardware.
  • Resolves assembly and production issues; reports quality issues and errors in manufacturing area; and informs supervisor of errors in manufacturing.
  • Uses appropriate tools to assemble and fasten all parts of the equipment per engineering and quality standards.
  • Maintain a clean and safe work area.
  • Additional duties may be assigned, dependent upon location and product line.

Requirements:

  • Preference for individuals who are currently enrolled or are graduates from Houston Community College, Lone Star College or San Jacinto College

  • Basic tool skills. Must be able to learn and understand how to operate basic tools.
  • Basic reading skills. Must be able to follow directions.
  • Ability to read and interpret basic engineering drawings, bills of materials, and other written instruction.
  • Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
  • High attention to detail and self-motivation skills
  • Ability to lift 30 to 75 pounds.
  • Ability to work 40hrs a week and overtime \ weekends as required.

title: Assembly Technician / General Shop Help
job_description:
Earn a $500 signing bonus paid out as $250 after your first 3 full months working with us and $250 after your first 6 months.

Are you an experienced assembler looking to get away from assembly lines and lots of overtime? Come join our team! Our manufacturing department is nothing like an assembly line production job. We assemble and test a wide variety of products each week! Everyone works day shift for work/life balance and our benefits package is top notch!

What will you be doing?

  • Assist shop personnel as needed to complete projects.
  • Maintain a clean working environment.
  • Assemble components and finished goods to product specifications.
  • Complete or modify mechanical assembly of components, sub-assemblies and finished goods.
  • Assemble some electrical elements of components, sub-assemblies and finished goods.
  • Assemble mechanical components, sub-assemblies and finished goods.
  • Ensure component performance conform to specifications.
  • Document and maintain manufacturing procedures for specified devices.
  • Diagnose and troubleshoot defects and errors in hydraulic and pneumatic components.
  • Identify and solve problems related to broken and defective mechanical components, products and equipment.
  • Calibrate, test and maintain production and test-associated equipment where applicable and designated.

What do you need to be considered for the job?

  • Natural ability to tinker with and fix things.
  • A "can-do" attitude - ability to solve problems.
  • Dependable - arrive at 7:00 am and be ready for the day.
  • Eagerness to learn new skills.
  • High school diploma or equivalent.

Rewards:

  • All Employees work Day Shift (we want everyone to have work-life balance!)
  • Seven Paid Holidays.
  • Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) Plan with 120 hours (3 weeks) accrued first year!
  • Opportunity to advance your skills AND your pay! As well as eLearning courses equivalent to TSTC.
  • Medical, Vision and Dental Insurance at affordable rates.
  • Company paid Life Insurance and Short Term Disability.

What does Amatrol do?

Bayport Technical is part of Amatrol which creates innovative, interactive learning solutions for industry and education to equip people with the skills to master technical systems, solve problems and adapt to a rapidly-changing workplace. We partner with our clients to provide an unmatched learning experience.

Our learning solutions are designed and built by employees who are experts in their field, integrating the best practices in education and training to deliver knowledge and skills for real jobs. Our success is defined by an ability to provide these solutions with world-class service and support.

Please contact Human Resources if you need any accommodations during the job application process due to a disability. Amatrol, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

* This position is not eligible for placement through outside recruiters.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Health insurance
  • Health savings account
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Referral program
  • Retirement plan
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

  • Signing bonus

Application Question(s):

  • Does the pay range listed in the job posting align with your salary expectations?

Experience:

  • Assembly: 1 year (Required)
  • Mechanical knowledge: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Commute:

  • La Porte, TX 77571 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Pump Assembler
job_description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a skilled Assembler to join our team. As an Assembler, you will be responsible for assembling and fabricating various components and products. This is a hands-on role that requires mechanical knowledge and the ability to use power tools and hand tools effectively.

Responsibilities:  
\- Read and interpret assembly instructions, blueprints, and schematics  
\- Use power tools, hand tools, and other equipment to assemble components  
\- Inspect parts for defects or damage  
\- Perform quality checks to ensure products meet specifications  
\- Follow safety guidelines and maintain a clean work area  
\- Collaborate with team members to meet production goals

Skills:  
-To excel in this role, you should have the following skills:

\- Proven Pump Assembly Experience Required.  
\- Previous experience in a warehouse or manufacturing environment  
\- Proficiency in using power tools and hand tools  
\- Mechanical knowledge to understand assembly processes  
\- Ability to read and interpret blueprints and schematics  
\- Strong attention to detail and quality control  
\- Ability to work independently as well as part of a team  
\- Forklift experience is required.

This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys working with their hands and has a passion for assembling and fabricating products. If you are a motivated individual with the required skills, we would love to hear from you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $16.00 - $19.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Work Location: In person

job_description:

title: Assembler
job_description:
An Assembler is responsible for putting together components or parts to create finished products. They follow blueprints, work instructions, or diagrams to assemble products using various tools and equipment. Assemblers may work in manufacturing or production environments and may be required to perform quality checks and ensure that products meet specifications. They may also be responsible for maintaining a clean and organized work area and reporting any issues or defects to supervisors. Attention to detail, manual dexterity, and the ability to work as part of a team are important skills for an Assembler. The Assembler will report to the Manufacturing Supervisor of the Assembly department, and will be responsible for assembling electrical units, switchgear and other Powell products.

Essential Responsibilities  Build and assemble mechanical components for Switchgear and/or Breaker units according to engineering drawings and customer specifications. Perform maintenance and proper use of tools. Perform in process inspections; ensure quality by following standard work instructions and identifying any potential risks to product quality. Perform all ship prep functions including splitting gear. Promote a safety culture as well as attend all safety meetings. Ensure that work areas remain clean and well organized.

Minimum Qualifications  Minimum education level of a High School Diploma or General Education Equivalent Diploma is preferred. Ability to read a tape measure (including conversions from fraction to decimal and conversely from decimal to fraction and metric to imperial). Basic knowledge of a variety of hand/power tools. Lift up to 50lbs using proper lifting techniques.

Preferred Qualifications  Basic computer knowledge considered an asset. Basic command of the English language, both written and verbal. Prior ability or interest in building or repairing mechanical components considered an asset. Read and understand spec sheets and follow proper use of hardware by spec requirements. Basic knowledge of one line and three-line drawings. Safety training certificates are an asset for the position.

Skills, Abilities & Other Requirements  Positive attitude. Willingness to learn. Ability to follow direction from Senior Assemblers and Lead Assemblers. Effectively demonstrates on-time delivery and the ability to stay focused on goals and responsibilities. Self-starter with ability to take on multiple tasks with a drive to succeed. Challenges the status quo; looks for better or more efficient ways to get results. Ability to adapt to new ideas, technology, processes or product changes. Believes and displays through actions that our customers represent our current success and remain vital to our future growth. Demonstrates integrity and ethical decision making. Conscientious, thorough, accurate, and reliable when performing and completing job tasks. Able to work effectively within your team and around other departments and their activities. Ability to learn and adhere to all manufacturing policies and practices to ensure adherence to ISO requirements.\  

Working Conditions  Safety sensitive position in a temperature-controlled manufacturing or industrial environment with occasional outside activities. Required to wear personal protective equipment (PPE) (i.e., safety shoes, hard hats, bump caps, safety glasses, hearing protection, safety harnesses as required) and respirators when required. Must be able to work from all type of ladders (step ladders, "A" frame ladders, etc.) Working at heights usually no higher than 20 feet in the air on an elevated structure using proper lift equipment and Fall Protection Equipment.

Physical Requirements  Able to maintain body equilibrium and agility to prevent falling when walking, standing, crouching, ascending or descending stairs or step ladders Bending the body at the waist, the legs at the knees, and extending arms and hands in any direction Continuous standing and walking Able to use upper extremities frequently, work with both arms above shoulders and use both arms at full length frequently. Must be able to meet physical lifting demand up to 50lbs. Frequent use of hand tools and power tools   

More Information   
This job description outlines the essential functions of the job and does not contain a comprehensive list of all possible responsibilities, tasks, and duties.

In our 75+ year history, Powell has always known that our employees are at the heart of our success. Without question, we have the most talented people in all parts of our organization. As a manufacturer, we recruit and hire experienced and knowledgeable applicants to ensure our product is engineered, fabricated, and assembled to customer specifications! 

Powells culture has and will always be founded in our "can do" attitude. If we can imagine it, we can do it. Become a part of our story and let us help you write yours. Hard work pays off in all our teams, with opportunity for advancement and promotion without sacrificing work-life balance. Successful candidates must have a legal authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis, with only those candidates selected for interview contacted. 

Powell offers comprehensive health insurance for you and your family, 401k savings, annual bonus potential, generous paid time off, professional development opportunities, company-sponsored wellness programs, and a collaborative work environment. 

EOE Protected Veterans/Disability 

If you need an accommodation in the hiring process, you may contact 713.378.2685. Application status inquiries will not be accepted in this manner.

title: Electrical Assembly Tester- 1st shift
job_description:
Eaton’s ES AMER ARS PDCAD division is currently seeking a Electrical Assembly Tester- 1st shift. The hourly rate for this position is $23.00 per hour. Please note the salary information shown above is a general guideline only. Salaries are based upon candidate skills, experience, and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

HOURS: 6AM - 2:30PM

Candidates must reside within 50 miles from our Houston, TX location OR Fayetteville, NC location (14825 Northwest Freeway, Houston TX OR 2900 Doc Bennett Rd. Fayetteville, NC). THOSE RESIDING IN FAYETTEVILLE MUST RELOCATE TO HOUSTON UPON COMPLETION OF TRAINING.

Candidates hired will be required to train for 6-8 weeks in the Fayetteville, NC location.

  • Houston-based individuals that travel to Fayetteville, NC to train will have expenses covered according to Eaton's Worldwide Travel and Expense Policy.
  • Fayetteville based individuals that live within 50 miles of our Fayetteville, NC location will receive a one-time lump sum relocation bonus of $5000 will be paid to hired candidates relocating to the Houston area upon completion of training.

A retention bonus will be paid to individuals hired according to the following schedule: $250 bonus after 3 months of employment; $500 bonus after 6 months of employment $1000 bonus after 1 year of employment.

Position will also be eligible for a variable incentive program beginning January, 2026.

Why work at Eaton? Below are a few of the outstanding benefits we offer:

  • Health benefits and vacation time - available to use on day one of your employment!
  • Paid holidays
  • Bi-Weekly pay
  • Career progression opportunities to cross-train in different departments and increase compensation.
  • Overtime opportunities
  • Retirement benefits
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Educational Assistance Program, Wellness Reimbursement, and more!

##  What you’ll do:

The electrical tester is responsible to Plan, electronically / electrically test, and inspect items such as standard Motor Control Center cells and structures, apparatus, units, panels, panel-boards, component parts, Enclosed Control, and Custom Control assemblies, in order to verify correct product function. Perform troubleshooting and repair as required. The electrical tester will perform this according to specifications, test and working procedures.

  • Work from oral and/or written instructions from supervisors and/or prints, diagrams and manufacturing information sheets.
  • Prepare apparatus for test and inspections in accordance with procedures and test specifications. Move apparatus to and from test and position as required.
  • Perform mechanical inspection and insulation tests as required.
  • Perform electrical sequence tests, according to the specifications, diagram or schematic, as required. Check out inter-related electrical circuits between separate cells where methods and procedures have been established. Check out metering circuits. Inspect and test standard and non-standard fixed assemblies.
  • Troubleshoot malfunctions of apparatus under test to determine causes and report findings to the supervisor, engineering, etc.
  • Ensure changes, corrections and repairs are made as required.
  • Ensure maintenance and calibration of equipment is being completed.
  • Assist in cell building and other MCC assembly tasks as needed/required by the business.

Position Criteria:

  • Work accordingly to established safety procedures
  • Work in conjunction with Engineering, Quality Control concerning test procedures, specifications and problems.
  • Make recommendations to other personnel concerning assembly, checking, calibration, and wiring procedures
  • Good communication and teamwork skills interfacing cross functionally and potentially with external customers
  • Requires strong attention to detail and following safety and quality processes
  • Ability to reach schematic drawings and trouble shoot electrical control circuits
  • Wear all safety equipment and observe all hygiene requirements as specified and directed

##  Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:

  • Must have a high school/GED with a minimum of two years' experience within a similar electrical assembly manufacturing environment.
  • OR an associate's degree in electrical/Electronic Technology/Engineering or related degree with a minimum of one year experience in related manufacturing and/or test position
  • OR a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering or related field
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Previous experience working with electrical control distribution assemblies and/or electrical testing.
  • Knowledge of mechanical and/or electrical engineering disciplines for product design and development
  • Previous experience testing with electrical current

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Eaton believes in second chance employment. Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction history will be considered regardless of their arrest or conviction history, consistent with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the California Fair Chance Act and other local laws.

You do not need to disclose your conviction history or participate in a background check until a conditional job offer is made to you. After making a conditional offer and running a background check, if Eaton is concerned about conviction that is directly related to the job, you will be given the chance to explain the circumstances surrounding the conviction, provide mitigating evidence, or challenge the accuracy of the background report.

To request a disability-related reasonable accommodation to assist you in your job search, application, or interview process, please call us at 1-800-836-6345 to discuss your specific need. Only accommodation requests will be accepted by this phone number.

We know that good benefit programs are important to employees and their families. Eaton provides various Health and Welfare benefits as well as Retirement benefits, and several programs that provide for paid and unpaid time away from work. Click here for more detail: Eaton Benefits Overview. Please note that specific programs and options available to an employee may depend on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

title: PCB Assembler
job_description:
Technician-PCB Assembler  
Houston, TX

  • Safely remove and replace soldered components on a PCB without damaging the rest of the PCB.
  • Must be proficient in understanding/interpreting electronic and/or electrical schematics/drawings/prints.
  • Experience with high temperature/high vibration electronics (such as gold soldering, etc.)

Summary

As a PCB Assembler, you will be integral to the manufacturing process, focusing on the assembly of printed circuit boards (PCBs) using surface mount technology. Reporting to the Production Supervisor, your role will involve interpreting schematics, soldering components, and ensuring quality standards are met in accordance with IPC 610 guidelines. Your core skills in electrical wiring and assembly, combined with your mechanical knowledge and proficiency with hand tools, will be essential for success. Join our team and contribute to the creation of innovative electronic products in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

  • Assemble printed circuit boards (PCBs) using surface mount technology and soldering techniques.
  • Interpret and work from schematics to ensure accurate assembly and wiring of electrical components.
  • Utilize hand tools and power tools for assembly tasks, ensuring precision and quality.
  • Conduct testing and troubleshooting of assembled boards using tools like ohmmeters and calipers.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace while adhering to IPC 610 standards for quality assurance.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Soldering: 2 years (Preferred)
  • PCB: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Wire Assembly Technician
job_description:
VETERANS ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY

Lonestar Integrated Solutions is seeking an experienced and highly organized Wire Assembly Technician to join our team. The ideal candidate will be able to provide effective and efficient cable assemblies in accordance with customer requirements and contribute positively to the daily production operations of the company. They will also be comfortable working with a high degree of attention to detail and discretion as well as incorporating new and effective ways to achieve better results.

Responsibilities:

  • Assemble harnesses, cables, and wire per required specifications.
  • Perform functional testing on assemblies.
  • Test assemblies per customer and/or division criteria.
  • Operate test equipment in compliance with engineering standards.
  • Prep assemblies for shipment.
  • Communicate regularly with supervisors on inventory or assembly problems.
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by management.

Requirements:

  • Production or shop experience working in a production role.
  • Strong safety mindset.
  • Soldering skills a plus.
  • Highschool diploma or GED
  • The ability to read, follow and interpret cable assembly instructions as well as engineering or customer drawings.
  • A good team player who enjoys collaborating with others.
  • Demonstrate solid verbal and written communication skills.
  • Knowledge of wiring color codes, connectors, lugs, and wire specifications.
  • Knowledge of crimping wires by industry best practices and broad knowledge of crimping tools and their correct use.

Physical Requirements:

  • Regularly works around moving mechanical parts and in warehouse conditions that are not always climate controlled and may include, heat and humidity.
  • Noise level may be loud at times.
  • Must be able to move objects and use abdominal and lower back muscles to provide support over time without fatigue. Constant movement and use of limbs; this position requires good manual dexterity, coordination, and stamina.

Benefits

  • Medical, dental, life and vision insurance
  • 401(k) Retirement Plan and Match
  • Paid Time Off
  • Specified Holiday Pay

Disclaimer:

This job description is a general outline of the day-to-day duties to be expected and may not cover all job responsibilities that may be assigned by management.

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for providing excellent office support, please apply today.

title: Control Valve Assembler
job_description:
Control Valve Assembler

Does working with minimal supervision excite you?

Do you love working with Valves?

Join our Quality Team

The Control Valve Assembler’s primary role is to ensure the proper functioning and quality of control valves by meticulously assembling and integrating their components.

Partner with the best

As a Control Valve Assembler, you will play a crucial role in the manufacturing process by assembling, testing, and inspecting control valves. Your expertise will ensure the production of high-quality control valves that meet industry standards and customer requirements. This is a hands-on position that requires a strong mechanical aptitude and a keen eye for precision

As a Control Valve Assembler, you will be responsible for:

  • Assembling and disassembling Pressure Control Equipment by reading and interpreting blueprints, assembly prints, and schematics.
  • Use of mechanical hand tools such as wrenches, ratchets, sockets, and screwdrivers.
  • Use of power tools such as battery-powered drills, and impacts.
  • Use of machinery such as overhead cranes, JIB cranes, and forklifts.
  • Assembling & attach functional hardware to assemblies using mechanical hand tools and power tools.
  • Performing functional/continuity tests on completed assemblies per procedures.
  • Performing the startup and function test of equipment systems.
  • Performing visual inspection of components to verify quality and correctness to the drawing.
  • Troubleshooting systems and make necessary repairs or corrections to system or processes.
  • Performing other work-related tasks as assigned.
  • Having experience working with control valves

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will require:

  • A Highschool Diploma or equivalent
  • Experience working with Control Valves

Work in a way that works for you

title: Mechanical Assembly Technician
job_description:
Summary:

ARC Specialties, a manufacturer of robotic and automated machinery has a need for an experienced Mechanical Assembler to join our team in Houston, TX to mechanically assemble and install custom machinery. This is a full time position with benefits. Some international and domestic travel may be required to install final product in customer facilities.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Mount, install, align, and secure machine components, operating various power hand tools.
  • Assemble, dismantle and overhaul machinery, conveyor systems, belt pulleys, mechanical clutches, gear boxes, hydraulic and pneumatic control systems, shafting, precision bearings, gear boxes, sheet metal covers, etc.
  • Assemble and relocate machines and equipment to the desired location according to floor plans, or as directed, using forklifts, hoists, winches, cranes, pulleys and other equipment.
  • Performs preventive maintenance before, during, and prior to shipment by following the provided assembly checklist. This includes but is not limited to greasing rails, ball screws, bearings, and seals.
  • Gauge completed assemblies using precision measuring instruments, to ensure conformity to specified tolerances.
  • Work in a team to complete projects in a timely and safe manner.
  • Ability to quickly adapt to multiple projects in a fast paced, deadline-oriented environment.
  • Wear proper PPE including safety shoes and safety glasses.
  • Work hours as directed.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Must be able to read blue prints and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Ability to properly move machinery and equipment using cranes, hoists, pulleys, and forklifts
  • Knowledge and ability to properly use tools and equipment such as drill presses, power saws, chain falls, jacks, skids, slings, burning torches, and other types of portable and hand tools
  • Ability to clean, lubricate, or adjust parts, equipment and machinery
  • Ability to perform incidental tasks as required to complete the larger task
  • Must understand how machinery functions to assemble and disassemble it properly. This involves knowledge of electronics, pneumatics, hydraulics and computer systems
  • Basic knowledge of mathematics, algebra, and physics
  • Must have personal tool box with tools with some special tools including but not limited to calipers, dial indicators, pneumatic impact wrench, torque wrench

Benefits:

Competitive Salary, Affordable Medical Insurance, 401K Retirement Plan with 4% match, Employer-Paid Basic Life Insurance/AD&D, Employer-Paid Long-Term Disability, Vision Plan, Dental Plan, Paid Holidays, Vacation Time, Profit Sharing

For consideration:

Submit an up-to-date resume in either Word or PDF format requirement to: Employment@arcspecialties.com. Include your salary requirement and summarize why you think your experience will satisfy the requirements of this position.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Assembly Supervisor
job_description:
Are you an Assembly Supervisor seeking career growth? Emerson has an exciting opportunity for you! Located at our manufacturing facility in Houston, TX, you will oversee and manage a team of hourly employees in a manufacturing environment, ensuring safety, production, and quality goals are met or exceeded. In this role, you will directly manage production employees, promote safety awareness, and motivate the team to achieve high productivity levels. You will also collaborate with other departmental supervisors and team leads to address and communicate any production-related issues.

IN THIS ROLE, YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL BE: 

  • Supervise assembly employees to ensure adherence to procedures and quality standards
  • Work closely with Engineering, Machine Shop Supervisor and Materials department to resolve issues.
  • Schedule and conduct daily toolbox meetings
  • Ensure productivity, safety, and quality key performance indicators (KPIs) are met.
  • Follow established company policies and Quality System procedures, ensuring products meet specifications and rejecting those that do not.
  • Train new personnel in various assembly areas to ensure skill development and process understanding
  • Implement and support 5S +1 and Lean initiatives to improve workplace organization and efficiency.
  • Close jobs and ensuring all materials are properly issued.
  • Develop and maintain clear work instructions for assembly processes.
  • Provide assistance in production as necessary to meet operational goals.

WHO YOU ARE: You are someone who breaks down objectives into appropriate initiatives and actions. You readily action new challenges, without unnecessary planning. You persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks. You understand that different situation may call for different approaches. You gain insight into customer needs. You create teamwork allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives.

FOR THIS ROLE, YOU WILL NEED: 

  • Diploma in any related field
  • 3+ years of job-related Assembly supervisory experience
  • Ability to read and understand reports, blueprints, and transition sheets.
  • Electrical wiring experience
  • Good mechanical skills
  • Ability to fairly enforce the rule
  • Ability to train and motivate employees
  • Strong planning, organization, problem solving, facilitation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Prior supervisory or leadership experience including direction, engagement, and coaching
  • Effective communication skills: verbal and written (English)
  • Ability to work in the US without need for sponsorship now or in the future

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS THAT SET YOU APART: 

  • 4+ year bachelor’s degree. and a minimum of 1+ years or more of experience in manufacturing with similar assembly supervisory responsibilities.
  • ISO experience
  • Previous Oracle experience and solid computer skills

Our Culture & Commitment to You 

At Emerson, we prioritize a workplace where every employee is valued, respected, and empowered to grow. We foster an environment that encourages innovation, collaboration, and diverse perspectives—because we know that great ideas come from great teams. Our commitment to ongoing career development and growing an inclusive culture ensures you have the support to thrive. Whether through mentorship, training, or leadership opportunities, we invest in your success so you can make a lasting impact. We believe diverse teams, working together are key to driving growth and delivering business results.

We recognize the importance of employee wellbeing. We prioritize providing flexible, competitive benefits plans to meet you and your family’s physical, mental, financial, and social needs. We provide a variety of medical insurance plans, with dental and vision coverage, Employee Assistance Program, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, employee resource groups, recognition, and much more. Our culture offers flexible time off plans, including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.

Learn more about our Culture & Values . 

#LI-BA1

#LI-ONSITE

WHY EMERSON 

Our Commitment to Our People 

At Emerson, we are motivated by a spirit of collaboration that helps our diverse, multicultural teams across the world drive innovation that makes the world healthier, safer, smarter, and more sustainable. And we want you to join us in our bold aspiration. 

We have built an engaged community of inquisitive, dedicated people who thrive knowing they are welcomed, trusted, celebrated, and empowered to solve the world’s most complex problems — for our customers, our communities, and the planet. You’ll contribute to this vital work while further developing your skills through our award-winning employee development programs. We are a proud corporate citizen in every city where we operate and are committed to our people, our communities, and the world at large. We take this responsibility seriously and strive to make a positive impact through every endeavor. 

At Emerson, you’ll see firsthand that our people are at the center of everything we do. So, let’s go. Let’s think differently. Learn, collaborate, and grow. Seek opportunity. Push boundaries. Be empowered to make things better. Speed up to break through. Let’s go, together. 

Work Authorization 

Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1(including those with OPT or CPT) , H-1, H-2, L-1, B, J or TN, or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire. 

Equal Opportunity Employer 

Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. 

Accessibility Assistance or Accommodation 

If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, please contact: idisability.administrator@emerson.com .  

ABOUT EMERSON 

Emerson is a global leader in automation technology and software. Through our deep domain expertise and legacy of flawless execution, Emerson helps customers in critical industries like life sciences, energy, power and renewables, chemical and advanced factory automation operate more sustainably while improving productivity, energy security and reliability. 

With global operations and a comprehensive portfolio of software and technology, we are helping companies implement digital transformation to measurably improve their operations, conserve valuable resources and enhance their safety. 

We offer equitable opportunities, celebrate diversity, and embrace challenges with confidence that, together, we can make an impact across a broad spectrum of countries and industries. Whether you’re an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring possibilities, or a recent graduate with an advanced degree, you’ll find your chance to make a difference with Emerson. Join our team – let’s go! 

No calls or agencies please.

title: Assembly Supervisor (Day Shift)
job_description:
## Summary

The Day Shift Assembly Supervisor oversees the construction of assigned projects as directed by the Senior Supervisor and planning team. He or she will be responsible to enforce all safety protocols put in place as well as contribute to creating and maintaining a strong safety culture. Evaluate and promote employee skill development, approve time, and report on productivity. Ensures assigned deliverables are completed per project schedules or contingency plans. Directly responsible for the completion of assembly work accurately, within budget, and to a high-quality standard.

##  Principle Responsibilities and Duties

  • Direct the assembly team, based on Senior Supervisor assigned daily tasks. Technical Specialist and Engineering input, to efficiently construct the project per drawings and the Assembly build Sequence (ABS)
  • Provide periodic project status updates to Senior Supervisor regarding assigned daily task progress of walkdown schedule dates, material risks, and assembly build challenges.
  • Direct and coach team members to achieve consistency across single design multi-build projects and similar products.
  • Review Assembly kickoff meeting content to gain understanding of the scope of work, seek clarifications, and provide feedback as applicable.
  • Approve labor hours.
  • Participate in the interview process and vet potential candidates for all assembly trades.

  • Provide feedback on employee skill level vs performance to Senior Supervisor(s) to allow for necessary adjustments and balancing amongst the teams.
  • Prepare for the assembly process by reviewing all applicable project information and deliverables produced by Engineering and Manufacturing Engineering during the Assembly Kick Off Meetings (AKOM)
  • Periodically report to Senior Supervisor(s) regarding project assembly labor costs such as usage of consumable materials, actual hours vs planned hours, and overtime.
  • Support the Senior Supervisor(s) and the planning team to achieve contingency plans and revised assembly target dates to meet customer expectations.
  • Leadership for the Enerflex 5S program.
  • Work with Senior supervisor and Safety committee to promote safety culture.
  • Provide feedback to Manufacturing Engineering regarding Assembly Build Sequences (ABS), planned hours and duration.
  • Manage activities with internal functional areas to support internal or external customer changes.
  • Completion and proper sign-off of the GPS Traveler for each module/project.
  • Ensure overall quality of the projects is to highest standard.
  • Coordinate with Material Control, Fabrication, and Paint to prioritize material deliveries to the floor.
  • Enforcement of safety protocols and programs such as AWARE Cards, Take5, JSA, JRA’s and safety topics
  • Coordinate with the Manufacturing Engineering group and Senior Supervisor(s) on scheduled trade meeting events and training in a timely manner (prior to the needed skill or increased demands).
  • Provide feedback to the Senior Supervisor(s) regarding headcount requirements, resource capabilities and skill levels.
  • Suggest the direct hire of contract employees based on resource demands and skill level, as applicable.
  • Coordinate with Technical Specialists to achieve realistic and efficient ABS plans and layouts.
  • Provide feedback to other Supervisors, Manufacturing Engineers, and other team members regarding potential process improvements.
  • Senior Supervisor and Technical Specialist to assign levels to employees.

##  Qualifications

  • 5-10 years’ experience packaging natural gas equipment.
  • Supervisory and leadership experience is preferred.
  • Must be able to interpret engineering drawings such as P&IDs, General Arrangements, and Electrical drawings.
  • Proficient user of Microsoft Office software such as Excel, Word, Teams, and Outlook.
  • Basic familiarities with ERP systems, such as SAP Project Systems (PS) and Production Planning (PP)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must be dependable, highly motivated, self-directed, have attention to detail, and have great organizational skills with a minimum amount of daily direct supervision

##  Physical Requirements

Fast-paced shop environment. Many tasks have high degrees of time sensitivity.

About Us:

Transforming Energy for a Sustainable Future. Enerflex is a premier integrated global provider of energy infrastructure solutions, covering gas processing, compression, power generation, refrigeration, cryogenic, energy transition, and water solutions. We proudly employ more than 5,000 highly skilled employees across over 25 countries worldwide.  

Enerflex places its core Values of Integrity, Commitment, Creativity, and Success into action across all aspects of the business. Our innovation, strong commitment to safety, and superior service to our customers positions us as the optimal partner to meet the needs of the dynamic energy industry.  

We foster a culture of ensuring our employees have the tools to do their jobs right, but to also thrive in their roles. We pride ourselves in our competitive wages, extensive rewards programs, celebration of successes of individuals and teams, and are committed to ensuring Enerflex remains a safe and inclusive space for all.

What Enerflex Offers You:

Full time employees enjoy the following benefits:

  • Generous healthcare, dental and vision plan
  • 401(k) employer matching
  • Generous paid time off program
  • Employee Equity Plan
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Fun office environment

Enerflex is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Enerflex grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, mental or physical disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Equal employment opportunities are provided in recruitment, hiring, promotions, wages, benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, tasks, duties, knowledge, skills, and abilities required.

title: Technician - PCB Assembler
job_description:
# Technician - PCB Assembler 

Date: 21 Apr 2025 

Location: Houston 

State: TX 

Country: US 

Company: LTTS 

Summary:

Electrical Technician-PCB Assembler.

Job Description and Responsibilities:

  • Performs functional testing, routine testing and analyzing using defined procedures of individual electronic circuits or Printed Circuit Boards (PCB).

  • Perform soldering and working with smaller wiring. Working with different types of soldering such as standard and high temperature soldering.

  • Safely remove and replace soldered components on a PCB without damaging the rest of the PCB.

  • Read design drawings and assemble PCBs from scratch as well as repair of PCBs.

  • Must be proficient in understanding/interpreting electronic and/or electrical schematics/drawings/prints.

  • Good to have or Knowledge of LabVIEW and PAD’s CAD software but not mandatory skill.

Job Skills & Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent degree.

  • Required basic soldering and/or electronics knowledge.

  • Relevant Industry Technical Certification is preferred.

  • 3+ years experience in an electrical field.

  • Advanced troubleshooting skills.

  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook).

title: PSAB BOSS: Labor Foreman/ Escort (Secret Clearance)
job_description:
Title:

PSAB BOSS: Labor Foreman/ Escort (Secret Clearance) 

Belong, Connect, Grow, with KBR! 

PROJECT SUMMARY

The KBR PSAB Program provides comprehensive BASE OPERATING SUPPORT-INSTALLATION (BOS-I) services at Prince Sultan Air Base (PSAB) in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA). These services are delivered to support the 378 Air Expeditionary Wing (AEW), mission partners, and tenant units, encompassing a diverse range of personnel including transient, temporary duty (TDY), permanent party, and rotational personnel. Additionally, the program extends its services to encompass five (5) remote Army sites within PSAB. This program ensures the seamless functioning of operations, maintenance, and support activities essential for the sustained mission readiness and operational effectiveness of PSAB and its associated units.

POSITION SUMMARY

As the Laborer Foreman, you supervise and assist fellow KBR partners and subcontracted personnel in their daily tasks. Provide management and leadership when and where needed to keep all employees engaged. Work with our customers and execute customer service skills. Have the ability to learn and work across a wide spectrum of KBR-led areas on PSAB including Morale, Welfare, and Recreation (MWR); Fitness Centers; the Learning Resource Center; a Full-Service Laundry facility; Lodging; Food Service Operations; Bottled Water Distribution; Power Production; and provide Escort to other country national (OCN) personnel as needed. Coordinate with work center leadership in operations and continuous improvements in all areas. Gain proficiencies in multiple areas and gain experience to grow into an ideal KBR member to better poise yourself for coordinator and management positions.

Additionally, you will oversee the timely completion of required reports and tasks in alignment with company and USAF standards. Your role will require a proactive and well-organized approach, coupled with a results-oriented mindset, to effectively coordinate all activities and ensure mission success. You will need to demonstrate exceptional teamwork skills, collaborating closely with colleagues to achieve common goals. Moreover, your willingness and ability to work extended hours when necessary to meet mission requirements will be crucial to the smooth operation of services.

Excellent interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills are essential for this position. You will be expected to interact effectively with personnel of diverse backgrounds and maintain positive relationships while delivering high-quality support. Your commitment to exceptional service delivery and your ability to communicate clearly and courteously will be paramount in ensuring a positive experience for all involved parties.

ROLES and RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Process personnel to and from the PSAB Visitors Control Center according to USCENTCOM escorting procedures.

  • Provide escorting support to Other Country Nationals (OCNs) in designated CES & FSS areas identified by the Site Manager.

  • Escort un-cleared personnel and monitor maintenance and BOS-I services.

  • Maintain logs of OCN contractors, conduct personnel counts before and after duties, and inform relevant personnel of escorted individuals and vehicles.

  • Communicate with OCN personnel at designated entry facilities, briefing them on rules and procedures upon badge issuance.

  • Monitor OCN work progress and ensure work zones are cleared by trained Force Protection military personnel.

  • Prevent OCNs from bringing prohibited items onto the base.

  • Maintain visual oversight of vehicles and personnel during monitoring duties.

  • Ensure safety and welfare of oneself and monitored personnel, including evacuation procedures in case of an attack.

  • Notify Project/Site Manager and Safety staff promptly of any unsafe working conditions.

  • Maintain alertness and respond appropriately to any arising situations, reporting suspicious behaviors or comments of TCN/OCNs.

  • Provide administrative and support services to deliver BOS-I.

  • Coordinate activities to facilitate efficient project/site operation.

  • Complete required reports and tasks in compliance with established policies, procedures, and company requirements.

  • Perform routine assignments and duties under direct supervision to support PSAB services.

  • Assist site leadership in fulfilling contractual reporting requirements to the United States Government.

  • Demonstrate excellent communication skills with all levels of management, client personnel, and subcontractors.

  • Promote and uphold KBR’s Zero Harm safety program policies and procedures.

  • Ensure successful service delivery to approximately 4,000 personnel, with a variance of plus or minus 10%.

  • Perform additional duties as assigned.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.

  • General knowledge and experience with facility and equipment operations and maintenance as well as with food and MWR services.

  • U.S. Citizen with a current U.S. Driver's License.

  • Must possess passport book (not passport card) with at least 13 months of remaining validity AND 6 blank visa/stamp pages remaining.

  • Active U.S. SECRET Security Clearance and/or ability to obtain.

  • Must be able to read, write, speak and understand English fluently.

  • Candidates must also meet CENTCOM MOD-15 theater requirements.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Minimum 2 years relevant work experience delivering DOD BASE OPERATING SUPPORT-INSTALLATION (BOS-I) or similar work in an overseas or contingency environment. USAF experience is Highly Desired.

  • USAF Security, Admin, and Technical AFSC or another similar Military/DOD MOS

  • Proficient in use of Microsoft Office Suite

  • Experience in contingency environments as well as knowledge & experience working with government contracts.

Material & Equipment 

  • May be exposed to potentially hazardous conditions that require wear of hard hats, gloves, steel toed boots, hearing protection, safety glasses and other personal protection equipment (PPE); may be required to push, pull and lift heavy equipment.

  • Use of Land Mobile Radios, cell phones, laptops, and other devices to maintain contact and accountability of work activities.

  • Learn to use work center specific equipment such as food preparation & cooking equipment in the DFAC; washers & dryers in the Laundry; assembly of room items & furniture in Lodging; tools used in power production & maintenance. Training is available on all equipment that may be used.

Working Environment

  • Work will be indoors and outdoors.

  • Exposure to heat, cold, dust, noise, chemicals may occur.

  • Overtime and shift work may be required depending on contractual needs as well as occasional travel.

  • Employees must comply with all Federal, State and Local regulations and published Company work rules as well as written instructions.

  • Task specific work environment training may be provided.

  • Must be prepared to function in a wartime or contingency environment to support U.S. interests.

Physical Activities 

  • Physical requirements include lifting up to 35lb, team lifting up to 50lbs, climbing, extended sitting, or standing, stooping, stretching, and bending.

  • Work may require using and wearing personal protective equipment such as, hearing and eye protection, hard hat, and steel-toed boots as well as Individual Protective Equipment (IPE) which may include but not limited to Level III plus/IV Individual Body Armor with both front and back ballistic plates, ACH helmet, clothing (undergarments, shirts and pants and/or coveralls), reflective vests/belts, sound suppression devices, etc.

  • Day-to-day physical requirements may involve standard office activities including sitting/standing for extended periods of time, attending meetings, use of keyboard and mouse repetitively, lifting and carrying less than 20 lbs. frequently, etc.

  • Work requires moderate physical exertion including walking to operating areas and walking upstairs.

KBR offers a selection of competitive lifestyle benefits which could include 401K plan with company match, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, flexible spending account, disability, paid time off, or flexible work schedule. We support career advancement through professional training and development.

title: Electronic Assembler
job_description:
MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL - MUST BE OK WITH TEMPORARY STRIKE/CONTRACT WORK

OCCUPATIONAL SUMMARY:

Plan, lay out, develop, fabricate parts, and build electrical/electronic wiring aids. Perform complete operations to fabricate, assemble and install production and/or first article units, such as control consoles, junction boxes, instrument panels, relay panels, battery racks, engine and interconnect harnesses. Follow solder legends and setup and operate flow soldering equipment to solder printed circuit boards and their components.

WORK PERFORMED:

Plan, lay out, develop, fabricate parts, and build electrical/electronic wiring aids for production use. Perform complete operations to fabricate, assemble and install production and/or first article units, such as control consoles, junction boxes, instrument panels, battery racks; engineand interconnect harnesses, working from schematics, wiring diagrams, operation instruction sheets, travelers, sketches: engineering detail drawings, oral instructions and established shop practices.

Review planning releases and engineering changes for their effect on wiring assemblies and modify wiring aids to incorporate required changes.

Select, brand, cut, route, fasten, solder, sleeve, tie and lug wires; assemble and install wiring harnesses; locate, drill, mount, and fasten components; install in proper sequence in control consoles, junction boxes, instrument panels and relay panels, resistors, capacitors, filters, diodes, circuit boards, heat and speed sensors, transformers, meters, malfunction status indicators, circuit breakers, and fuses. Follow detailed solder legends and set up and operate flow soldering equipment to solder printed circuit boards and their components

.Check own work by means of continuity tester, voltmeters, ohmmeters, power supplies, bridges, or testing fixtures.

May perform work operations under direct guidance where adequate information has not yet been determined and furnished such as routing and part locations and where critical dimensions, locations, adjustments, and coordinated locations are required.

Perform rework of the nature and level of difficulty described herein.

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 4 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Evening shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift

Work Location: On the road

title: Warehouse Assembler - WEEKLY PAY + BENEFITS!!
job_description:
Company Overview

Job&Talent is a world-leading marketplace for essential work, dedicated to matching talented individuals with great companies through our innovative platform. With a remote-first approach and operations across multiple countries, we leverage technology to create reliable and flexible work opportunities while building agile workforces for our clients.

Summary

As an Assembler at Job&Talent, you will play a vital role in the manufacturing process by assembling and fabricating products to meet quality standards. This position is key to ensuring efficient operations within our partnered manufacturing facilities, contributing to our mission of connecting great people with great companies.

Responsibilities

  • Assemble and fabricate components according to specifications and quality standards.
  • Operate hand and power tools safely and efficiently during the assembly process.
  • Maintain a clean and organized workspace within the assembly line.
  • Collaborate with team members to meet production goals and deadlines.
  • Conduct quality checks on finished products to ensure compliance with standards.
  • Report any equipment malfunctions or safety concerns to supervisors promptly.
  • Assist in training new employees on assembly techniques and safety protocols.
  • Adhere to all safety regulations and company policies while working in a manufacturing environment.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience in assembly or fabrication roles, preferably in a manufacturing setting.
  • Strong mechanical knowledge with the ability to troubleshoot basic issues.
  • Familiarity with operating hand tools, power tools, and machinery safely.
  • Experience working on an assembly line is highly desirable.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
  • Basic understanding of warehouse operations is a plus but not required.
  • Forklift certification is beneficial but not mandatory; training may be provided if needed.

If you are ready to take your skills to the next level in an exciting remote-first company that values innovation and flexibility, we invite you to apply today at Job&Talent!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $11.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • 401(k) matching
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Electro-Mechanical Assembler
job_description:
Job description: Assembles products that consist of both electrical and mechanical components, required to carefully fit and connect wires, circuits, and mechanical parts according to blueprints and specifications, often using hand tools, power tools, and specialized equipment to create a fully functional product; this may include tasks like reading schematics/blueprints, soldering, aligning parts, testing functionality, and quality inspection.

  • Preparing electrical components like wires, connectors, and circuit boards, and mechanical parts like brackets, housings, and shafts for assembly.
  • Creating and routing wire harnesses according to schematics, including stripping, crimping, and soldering connections.
  • Ensuring proper alignment and fit of mechanical parts within the assembly.
  • Performing functional testing of the assembled unit to verify proper electrical and mechanical operation, identifying and correcting any defects.
  • Interpreting technical drawings, schematics and blueprints to understand component placement and assembly sequence

Job Types: Contract, Temporary

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Overtime
